channel.title: Item Positions
channel.description: On some clients youll click to wield an item. and it will go in your weapon slot. particularly party hats. how can i fix it. I know it has something to do with class 8.

item.title: Item Positions
item.dc:creator: @hartman hartman
item.description:
@hartman wrote:

thats in class 8, or item.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Item Positions
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“hartman, post:3, topic:164333”]your my savior
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 12, 2007, 04:31:30 PM[/size][hr]wait so what arrays go to what…and how do i edit item id’s.[/quote]Just add in the IDs, or change them as you wish.

For example, here’s part of my capes[] array:

	public static int capes[] = {7535,3759,3761,3763};

That right there shows that those 4 numbers, or the item IDs, when worn, are put in the cape slot. In otherwords, this eventually tells the client to make the item be worn on your back. Just add in more numbers (item IDs, for example 6570 is fire cape) to your liking. Seperate them by commas, and make sure the last one does not have a comma after it.

Enjoy.

Read full topic

item.title: Item Positions
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

To decide which item goes into which slot, you have to edit the neccessary file server-side. So, you were wrong when saying class8. That is a client-related file and is not needed right now.

Look for something named Item.java in your server files, and open that up.
There you will find a list of numbers, or item IDs.
Each item ID is listed in a different array[] and the name of the array is where it goes.
Edit to your liking.

Read full topic
